intro: Pyrrocoma rigida, commonly known as the rigid pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its sturdy, woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its unique floral structure and hardy nature make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
